Articles.Content:
Hello! I [updated!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) to 0.90 just a week ago. I know there's already 1.0, but most of the mods are still 0.90. But the problem here is that the squad parts from the Gamedata folder doesn't even load. The loading screen just stays at them. Here are some notable things just in case:

- I have 1 mod on, but it loads properly in the loading screen, but in case you're wondering, it's BahmutoD's Armory mod.

- I have checked KSP.log, and it doesn't say anything else is loading.

- I took out Ksp 64 bit since I don't need it.

- My [computer!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) is a 10.7.5 Mac.

- The parts that seem to have a problem were the [engine!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) parts.

 - The first item was an [engine!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) somewhere around the lines of OMS [Engine!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/).

 - I removed the OMS [engine!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) folder , and the next thing was the Ion Engine, I didn't [continue!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) removing files since I know it will go on forever.

PLEASE, I REALLY WANT TO TRY THE MOD AND THE 0.90 FEATURES.

[Thank!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) you for your time
Moved to Support (modded installs). Please read the [thread=92229]How to Get Support[/thread] sticky. We'll need more information to help.

**KSP:** 0.90 Mac 32bit

**Problem:** 0.90 Engines Don't Load

**Mods Installed:** 

Bahatumod Armory v0.7.3

**Reproduction Steps:** 

Install Bahatumod Armory, place in GameData folder, then run KSP through the app, not launcher.

**Log:** 

<link> Player.log

> 
> **KSP:** 0.90 Mac 32bit
> **Problem:** 0.90 Engines Don't Load
> 
> **Mods Installed:** 
> 
> Bahatumod Armory v0.7.3
> 
> **Reproduction Steps:** 
> 
> Install Bahatumod Armory, place in GameData folder, then run KSP through the app, not launcher.
> 
> **Log:** 
> 
> <link> Player.log

You seem to have missed a link there ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> You seem to have missed a link there ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![Screenshot%202015-05-04%2016.11.33.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/rj4tpwd0z4tq99t/Screenshot%202015-05-04%2016.11.33.png?dl=0)

This is the thing that popped up when I tried to load KSP WITHOUT OMS Engine, still the same thing with OMS though.

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/rj4tpwd0z4tq99t/Screenshot%202015-05-04%2016.11.33.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/rj4tpwd0z4tq99t/Screenshot%202015-05-04%2016.11.33.png?dl=0)
The whole log, please. It often contains more information about why something went wrong, rather than just what went wrong.

There are some other errors in the log while KSP is loading parts. Somehow, KSP has lost the definition for CompoundPart and the Engine category for parts. ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

It's unlikely, but possible that renaming KSP.app to KSP 0.90.app caused this. If renaming it doesn't work, try reinstalling KSP, testing it, then installing BDArmory from a fresh download. You can get that on KerbalStuff. If that works, just copy over your save.

> 
> There are some other errors in the log while KSP is loading parts. Somehow, KSP has lost the definition for CompoundPart and the Engine category for parts. ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)
> It's unlikely, but possible that renaming KSP.app to KSP 0.90.app caused this. If renaming it doesn't work, try reinstalling KSP, testing it, then installing BDArmory from a fresh download. You can get that on KerbalStuff. If that works, just copy over your save.

Been there, done that. I have reinstalled KSP before to see if that helped, it didn't. And it still crashed before my renaming of KSP. ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

> 
> I took out Ksp 64 bit since I don't need it.

What do you mean by this? What exactly did you take out?

> 
> Been there, done that. I have reinstalled KSP before to see if that helped, it didn't. And it still crashed before my renaming of KSP. ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

Are you saying that stock KSP without any files removed crashes before loading?

In any case, BDArmory is one of [thread=116916]the many mods that have been updated for KSP 1.0[/thread].

Yes, I have recently heard that it got updated, so I will be updating that. And Ksp 64 bit came from my windows computer which (unfortunately) is too laggy. My Mac runs ksp waaayyyyy smoother than the windows. Still a bummer though. :'(

Thanks for your help tho. And yes, it does do that. And just incase, though, If for some stupid reason updating fails, I will post back here for help. Sincerely freeguy12

- - - Updated - - -

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-07T23:06:03Z" title="05/07/2015 11:06  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 7, 2015</time> by Master Tao**
  
add [CODE] tag

Yes, Patcher isn't working, and hasn't been on Macs for a while. Of course, now everyone else feels our pain.

You can still download the full game from your KSP Store account and then copy over anything you want, though it's usually best to start fresh with both mods and saves after major updates.
Okay then, thought there would be a faster solution (It takes ten min.) Thanks again, for everything.
